DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Specimen Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Cell Positive Finding Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the percentage of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) in a tissue (bone marrow) specimen. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Positive Cell Count
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia.  It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001)_Involving advantage or good._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia, and comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  The clinical course is indolent, but this type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia.  It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001)

Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Determining the number or amount of something.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center adoption of C3D
